channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MS

item.title: Report X-2024021370
item.description:
Report X-2024021370

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-07
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazardous materials were used to gather the spilled hazmat put in hazmat bag in a pail. DescribePack: loose caps caused leakage from inside the box which caused package to be torn and ripped DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: hazmat materials were used to clean spill

  • Description: SequenceEvent: package handler noticed leaking substance from box, DescribePack: box has bucket inside with bottom cracked DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA retrieved box and secured it in proper hazmat area.

item.title: Report X-2024021210
item.description:
Report X-2024021210

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was pushed off IC belt by L1-1. The cap was loose on content, causing internal leakage. DescribePack: The content cap became loose due to being pushed off IC belt.. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately placed in a plastic bag and absorbent pads were used to soak up spill..

item.title: Report X-2024020778
item.description:
Report X-2024020778

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was in Gateway area, inside container AMJ 66240 FX. The package was already wet from internal leakage. Two caps were slightly loosened. DescribePack: The package had begun to tear, due to the over absorption of the hazardous material. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed inside a plastic bag and had absorbed majority of the hazardous material.

item.title: Report X-2024020749
item.description:
Report X-2024020749

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND INSIDE OF NON-HAZARDOUS TOTE. THE PACKAGE WAS COMPLETELY DESTROYED. DescribePack: THE BOTTOM AND THE SIDES OF THE PACKAGE WET. THE LEAKAGE WAS ABSORBED THROUGHOUT THE CARDBOARD BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PROPERLY HANDLED USING THE CORRECT HAZARDOUS MATERIALS SPILL CLEAN UP.
